docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 24 -- President Juan Antonio Rios declared at a press conference today that no agreements of any kind would be signed by him during his visit to the United States, explaining that his announced trip, on which he expected to...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 24 -- President Juan Antonio Rios declared at a press conference today that no agreements of any kind would be signed by him during his visit to the United States, explaining that his announced trip, on which he expected to start Oct. 15, was merely the result of an invitation -- much esteemed by Chile -- that President Roosevelt had extended and that the trip would be carried out with absolute freedom.

headline.main: ANY PACT RULED OUT ON RIOS VISIT TO U.S.; Chilean President Says That No Agreements Will Be Signed

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 -- An agreement by the United States and Great Britain for partition of world areas in which each will exclusively buy fats, oils and oil seeds for all United Nations' use was announced today by the Combined Food Board composed...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 -- An agreement by the United States and Great Britain for partition of world areas in which each will exclusively buy fats, oils and oil seeds for all United Nations' use was announced today by the Combined Food Board composed of representatives of the two countries.
docs.abstract: Combined Food Bd repts on US-Brit buying and allocation plan for United Nations use

headline.main: U.S., BRITAIN AGREE ON BUYING FATS, OILS; Combined Food Board Tells of Move to Coordinate the Purchase and Allocation FOR UNITED NATIONS' USE World Markets Divided, the Empire Going to British and Americas Mostly to Us

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 8 (U.P.) -Former Vice President Julio A. Roca died today. He was 69 years old. Dr. Roca had been ill with pneumonia for fifteen days.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 8 (U.P.) -Former Vice President Julio A. Roca died today. He was 69 years old. Dr. Roca had been ill with pneumonia for fifteen days.

headline.main: JULIO A. ROCA DIES; ARGENTINE LEADER; Former Vice President, Who Was Champion of United Nations, Stricken at 69 AN EX-ENVOY TO BRAZIL Retired as Foreign Minister in 1941 -- Negotiated Tariff Pact With Britain

docs.snippet: The Canadian dollar was irregular last week. Working down from 87.50 cents, on Monday, it sold at 86.62 cents on Thursday, to rebound slightly to 87 cents, at the close, for a loss of 7/16 cent from the preceding week. The absence of buying in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian dollar was irregular last week. Working down from 87.50 cents, on Monday, it sold at 86.62 cents on Thursday, to rebound slightly to 87 cents, at the close, for a loss of 7/16 cent from the preceding week. The absence of buying in the face of even modest offerings accounted for the softer tone.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED OCTOBER 10, 1942

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 -- Sumner Welles, acting secretary of State, denied today an Argentine report that Felipe A. Espil, the Argentine Ambassador here, had recently told him that Argentina would not sever relations with the Axis.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 -- Sumner Welles, acting secretary of State, denied today an Argentine report that Felipe A. Espil, the Argentine Ambassador here, had recently told him that Argentina would not sever relations with the Axis.

headline.main: WELLES IS RETICENT ON ARGENTINA, CHILE; Denies U.S. Has Sought Other Republics' Backing in Situation
